game.name: Sum Fun with MD5

game.description:
Can you find the secret page? 

- fruitcup

hints.hint:
The url is located at: https://ctf.uvucsc.com/supersecret236

You could have found this by inspecting the source of the front page.

Once there, you wont see anything useful. 
To dig deeper, inspect the page's html source.

You should see a html comment with a base64 string. 
Decode it using your online tool of choice. 

The decoded text is using a very basic cypher.

game.name: Find The Secret!

game.description:
We found this file on our network. 
What is this??
<iframe src="https://giphy.com/embed/l4JyOwGH26UNQebBK" width="460" height="230" frameBorder="0" class="giphy-embed" allowFullScreen></iframe>


\- BashNinja - [@miketweaver](https://twitter.com/miketweaver)

hints.hint:
Unfortunately `file` didn't work here. 

That's because the (magic numbers)[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Magic_number_(programming)#Magic_numbers_in_files] that `file` uses is broken.
You'll want to pop out a hex editor for this one.
Might be useful to read about why `file` doesn't work on this. What does file use to figure out what things are?
Look at the file in a hex editor. Look at the ASCII strings near the beginning of the file. Now google that.

game.name: What is this!?

game.description:
Did you know that every Sunday [@AaronToponce](https://twitter.com/AaronToponce) posts Viginere or Cryptograms on his [@CipherMonkey](https://twitter.com/CipherMonkey) twitter account? This challenges is to solve this week's HARD challenge.

Difficulty: 🦍
Type: Cryptogramhttps://t.co/zWkSu0e1h5 pic.twitter.com/RWj4qBJY7O

— Cipher Monkey (@CipherMonkey) January 28, 2018
Submit the solved version as you would read it. Example submission: `this is a really cool challenge and i like it` Make sure you tweet [@CipherMonkey](https://twitter.com/CipherMonkey) and let him know you solved it! They love seeing people play with their challenges. \- BashNinja - [@miketweaver](https://twitter.com/miketweaver)

hints.hint: Here's a useful [Tutorial](http://www.cryptograms.org/tutorial.php).
Here's my favorite [tool](http://scottbryce.com/cryptograms/).
Here's a [tool](https://quipqiup.com/) that'll break cryptograms automatically.

game.name: @CypherMonkey

game.description:
Ciphertext:
`LKAMALZFY MHIKUXZ ZRPVNSGSUX AZJ'T CACX DLOTZFY VRFLS, WSJF BFU. - HRF KHLF`


Enter the cipher key in this format:
`librarian`

\- BashNinja - [@miketweaver](https://twitter.com/miketweaver)

hints.hint: Key length: `8`
[Guide](https://ciphermonkey.rocks/vigenere_analysis.html) teaching how to crack these.
[Tool](http://www.guballa.de/pages/geocaching/vigenere-solver.php) that'll crack it automagicly.

game.name: Vigenère

game.name: Not Enough Love

game.description:
Find the flag hidden in the provided .pcap file. 
You can use Wireshark to view the packet. 

Key is all lowercase.

- fruitcup

hints.hint: How does an image end up on your computer? What type of packets are involved? You should be looking for a GET request and individual TCP streams of each GET request to pngs.
If you feel like you are very close, you may be having problems reading the image. The ones and sevens look like eachother, so try sorting them out.

game.name: wargames

game.description:
It looks like we've been given access to a binary from the [WOPR](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/WarGames).

You should take a look and see if Professor Falken left any extra surprises.

Professor Falken compiled this on all your OSes for you. Isn't he so kind?

Note:
These binaries is guaranteed to NOT be malicious. Nonetheless, there is still a flag in it for you to find.

\- BashNinja - [@miketweaver](https://twitter.com/miketweaver)

hints.hint: The linux and mac binaries are easier.
You're looking to run the "DecryptMystring()" function.

On the Linux binary, here's the Address for the function mentioned in the other Hint.
0x102a

hints.hint: Who would have the Audacity to do this?

game.name: Audio Medic!

game.description: I had a picture saved on a flashdrive, but I ignored the "Safely Remove Hardware" warning and unplugged it. Now I cant see my files!

hints.hint:
You are given a bzip2 file, you should extract it first. 
$ tar -xvf picture.img.tar.bz2
1fdb86c25131bb3aa247bada29b29115.img

$ file 1fdb86c25131bb3aa247bada29b29115.img
1fdb86c25131bb3aa247bada29b29115.img: Linux rev 1.0 ext4 filesystem data, UUID=1385df22-b2ce-4b4f-858e-79ae1932ca1a (extents) (huge files)

It looks like this is an ext4 filesystem. If you try and mount it you will find nothing inside. Using extundelete will reveal that this filesystem is corrupted. You should try and repair it.

game.name: Save my Files!
